greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerator of 1/n + 2/(n-1) + 3/(n-2) +...+ (n-1)/2 + n.
comment: Numerator of a second order harmonic number H(n, (2)) = Sum[HarmonicNumber[k], {k, 1, n}]. - _Alexander Adamchuk_, Apr 12 2006
p divides a(p-3) for prime p>3. - _Alexander Adamchuk_, Jul 06 2006
Denominator is A027611(n+1). p divides a(p-3) for prime p>3. - _Alexander Adamchuk_, Jul 26 2006
a(n) = A213998(n,n-2) for n > 1. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 03 2012
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Harmonic Number.
formula: Numerators of coefficients in expansion of -log(1-x)/(1-x)^2. Numerators of (n+1)*(harmonic(n+1)-1). Numerators of (n+1)*(Psi(n+2)+gamma-1). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Sep 02 2002
a(n) = numerator of integral_{x=1..n+1} floor((n+1)/x). - _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 18 2013
maple: ZL:=n->sum(sum(1/i, i=2..n), j=1..n): a:=n->floor(numer(ZL(n))): seq(a(n), n=2..27); # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jun 14 2007
program: a027612 n = numerator $ sum $ zipWith (%) [1 .. n] [n, n-1 .. 1]
(PARI) a(n) = numerator(sum(k=1, n, k/(n-k+1))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 14 2018
results.author: Glen Burch (gburch(AT)erols.com)
